components: airfoil shaped portion (payload connector rudder feature)
functions: couple propulsion assembly to first end of boom
surround rotor blades with shroud
dispose paddles between rotor blades and boom
rotate first wing about axis through its length via first rotating joint
rotate second wing about axis through its length via second rotating joint
accommodate rotation of propulsion assembly with respect to boom
transition aircraft from vertical flight to horizontal flight
fold wing substantially parallel with boom (first position)
unfold wing from boom (second position)
power propulsion assembly with electrical energy source
rotate paddles about stanchion
modify direction that moving air is displaced relative to boom
rotate individual paddles about axes through their lengths
spin boom about axis through length of boom in vertical flight
suspend boom substantially vertically from propulsion assembly
rotate wings together with boom in vertical flight
orient wings substantially perpendicular to boom (second position)
generate vertical thrust during vertical flight mode
generate horizontal thrust during horizontal flight mode
generate lift with wings during horizontal flight mode
unfold wings during transition from vertical to horizontal flight
orient boom substantially horizontally in horizontal flight mode
move wings independently with respect to one another
connect to payload while aircraft is in flight
transfer electrical energy between energy source and payload during flight
operate payload connector airfoil as rudder during flight
effects: Flight mode conversion between vertical and horizontal flight
Directional control via paddle air displacement
Aerodynamic lift generation in horizontal flight
Electrical power delivery to payload during flight
Improved propulsion efficiency via ducted configuration
Stabilized vertical flight via wing-boom rotation

canonical_mapping.notes: In VTOL context, serves as main load-bearing structure, component housing, and can orient vertically or horizontally

canonical_mapping.claim_feature: Propulsion assembly with shrouded rotor blades
canonical_mapping.notes: Rotor blades surrounded by shroud/duct for improved efficiency, safety, and noise reduction

canonical_mapping.claim_feature: Rotating joint for wing rotation about lengthwise axis
canonical_mapping.notes: Enables wing folding/unfolding by rotating about axis parallel to wing length (spanwise rotation)

canonical_mapping.claim_feature: Transition from vertical to horizontal flight
canonical_mapping.notes: Core defining characteristic of convertible VTOL aircraft; achieved via propulsion tilting

canonical_mapping.claim_feature: Second rotating joint for propulsion assembly tilt
canonical_mapping.notes: Enables transition between flight modes via thrust vectoring; rotates propulsion relative to boom
Rotate about stanchion to modify air displacement direction; provide directional control and anti-torque
Powers electric propulsion system; housed within boom structure
Wings fold to parallel position for compact storage; unfold to perpendicular for flight
Fixed vanes within shroud to improve ducted rotor efficiency and reduce swirl
Enables in-flight payload attachment and electrical power transfer; includes dual-function airfoil rudder
Boom hangs vertically during VTOL mode; transitions to horizontal for cruise flight

canonical_mapping.claim_feature: Wings rotate with boom in vertical flight
canonical_mapping.notes: Wings and boom rotate together as unit to counter rotor torque in hover

primary_cpc_codes.description: Aircraft capable of landing or taking off vertically, e.g. vertical take-off and landing [VTOL] aircraft
primary_cpc_codes.relevance: This is the primary classification for the claimed invention. The aircraft explicitly describes vertical flight capability and transition to horizontal flight, which is the defining characteristic of VTOL aircraft. Claims 1, 11-16 specifically describe vertical flight mode, transition mechanisms, and horizontal flight mode.
primary_cpc_codes.coverage: Covers overall aircraft concept, vertical flight capability, flight mode transition mechanism, boom vertical suspension, and convertible flight configuration

primary_cpc_codes.description: Rotorcraft; Helicopters - Tilting of rotor bodily relative to fuselage
primary_cpc_codes.relevance: The second rotating joint is explicitly configured to rotate the propulsion assembly with respect to the boom to transition from vertical to horizontal flight (claims 1, 13). This is precisely the tilting rotor mechanism covered by this classification.
primary_cpc_codes.coverage: Covers the second rotating joint, propulsion assembly tilt mechanism, rotation of thrust unit relative to boom, and flight mode transition via rotor tilting

primary_cpc_codes.relevance: Claims 2, 10, 12, 15, 17 describe wings that fold substantially parallel with the boom and unfold to perpendicular positions via rotating joints. This is explicitly a foldable/deployable wing mechanism, with rotation about the wing's lengthwise axis.
primary_cpc_codes.coverage: Covers first and second rotating joints for wing rotation, wing folding mechanism parallel to boom, wing deployment to perpendicular position, and independent wing movement

primary_cpc_codes.description: Rotorcraft; Helicopters - Arrangements of rotors - Rotors with ring or Coanda effect
primary_cpc_codes.relevance: The propulsion assembly comprises rotor blades surrounded by a shroud (claim 1), which is a ducted/shrouded rotor configuration. This classification covers rotors enclosed in a ring or duct structure, matching the claimed shroud configuration.
primary_cpc_codes.coverage: Covers shrouded propulsion assembly, rotor blades within shroud, ducted fan/rotor configuration, and optional stator vanes (claim 5)

primary_cpc_codes.description: Arrangement or mounting of power plants in aircraft - Electric power supply
primary_cpc_codes.relevance: Claim 3 explicitly includes an electrical energy source disposed in the boom that powers the propulsion assembly, and claim 19 describes the boom housing an electrical energy source. This makes it an electrically-powered aircraft requiring this classification.
primary_cpc_codes.coverage: Covers electrical energy source, electric propulsion system, power storage in boom, battery/power supply arrangement, and electrical power delivery to payload (claim 19)

related_main_groups.description: Fuselages; Constructional features common to fuselages, wings, stabilising surfaces or the like

sibling_subgroups.relationship: Alternative VTOL configuration using wing tilting instead of rotor tilting

child_subgroups.relevance: Directly covers the second rotating joint tilt mechanism design

child_subgroups.description: VTOL aircraft - Electric drive for the rotor
child_subgroups.relevance: Covers electric propulsion system for VTOL rotor

child_subgroups.description: VTOL aircraft - Transition between flight modes - Control during transition
child_subgroups.relevance: Relevant to wing deployment and control during flight mode transition

google_patent_queries.search_string: (CPC=B64C29/00 OR CPC=B64C29/04) AND CPC=B64C27/52 AND CPC=B64C27/26 AND CPC=B64C3/56 AND "tilting rotor" AND "shrouded" AND "foldable wing" AND "boom" AND "vertical flight" AND "horizontal flight"
google_patent_queries.strategy: Requires all four primary CPC codes plus exact terminology for tilt-rotor, shrouded propulsion, foldable wings, boom structure, and both flight modes. Targets patents with all core claimed features.
google_patent_queries.target: Patents that are virtually identical to this specific VTOL tilt-rotor design with ducted fan and foldable wings rotating about lengthwise axis

google_patent_queries.search_string: CPC=B64C29/04 AND CPC=B64C27/26 AND CPC=B64D27/24 AND ("ducted rotor" OR "shrouded rotor" OR "ducted fan") AND ("folding wing" OR "rotating wing") AND "electric*" AND "transition"
google_patent_queries.strategy: Combines tilt-rotor, ducted rotor, and electric propulsion CPCs with key terminology variations for shrouded propulsion, wing folding, and flight mode transition. Includes electric propulsion requirement.
google_patent_queries.target: Electric VTOL tilt-rotor aircraft with ducted fans and articulating wing mechanisms for compact storage

google_patent_queries.search_string: (CPC=B64C29/00 OR CPC=B64C27/52) AND (CPC=B64C27/26 OR CPC=B64C11/30) AND ("tilt* rotor" OR "pivot* propulsion" OR "rotat* thrust") AND ("shroud*" OR "duct*") AND ("wing" AND ("fold*" OR "deploy*" OR "retract*"))
google_patent_queries.strategy: Expands to include general shrouded propeller codes, uses wildcards for tilting variations, and broadens wing articulation terminology. Captures similar mechanisms with different naming conventions.
google_patent_queries.target: VTOL aircraft with tilting shrouded propulsion systems and any form of retractable or deployable wing configuration

google_patent_queries.search_string: CPC=B64C29/00 AND CPC=B64D27/24 AND ("transition" OR "convert*") AND ("vertical" AND "horizontal") AND "flight mode" AND ("wing" AND ("articul*" OR "pivot*" OR "rotate*"))
google_patent_queries.strategy: Focuses on VTOL with electric power and flight mode transition capability, with emphasis on articulating wings. Doesn't require specific propulsion shrouding or tilting mechanism.
google_patent_queries.target: Electric VTOL aircraft capable of transitioning between flight modes with adjustable wing systems, regardless of specific propulsion type

google_patent_queries.search_string: (CPC=B64C29/00 OR CPC=B64C39/02) AND ("shroud*" OR "duct*" OR "enclosed" OR "cowl*") AND ("rotor" OR "propeller" OR "fan") AND ("wing" AND "boom") AND ("vertical" OR "hover")
google_patent_queries.strategy: Broadens to include unconventional aircraft classification, any enclosed rotating propulsion, and basic boom-wing architecture. Captures non-traditional VTOL designs.
google_patent_queries.target: VTOL or unconventional aircraft with enclosed rotors/fans, boom structure, and wings for hover/vertical flight capability

google_patent_queries.search_string: CPC=B64C AND ("tilt*" OR "pivot*" OR "rotat*" OR "swivel*") AND ("propulsion" OR "rotor" OR "thruster" OR "motor") AND ("boom" OR "fuselage" OR "body") AND ("VTOL" OR "vertical takeoff" OR "convertible")
google_patent_queries.strategy: Uses broad aircraft subclass with functional equivalents for adjustable propulsion orientation and alternative structural terms. Captures diverse tilting propulsion implementations.
google_patent_queries.target: Any VTOL or convertible aircraft with adjustable propulsion orientation and boom/fuselage structure for mode transitions

google_patent_queries.search_string: (CPC=B64C29/00 OR CPC=B64C27/00 OR CPC=B64C39/00) AND ("control surface" OR "vane" OR "deflector" OR "paddle" OR "rudder") AND ("vertical flight" OR "hover") AND ("wing" OR "airfoil" OR "lift surface")
google_patent_queries.strategy: Expands to general VTOL and rotorcraft classes, includes various control surface terminology (paddles/vanes), and broadens wing terminology. Explores control mechanism approaches.
google_patent_queries.target: VTOL and rotorcraft with directional control surfaces, vanes, or deflectors and wing or lift-generating surfaces

google_patent_queries.search_string: CPC=B64C AND ("electric* motor" OR "battery" OR "fuel cell" OR "electric* energy") AND ("vertical" OR "hover" OR "VTOL") AND ("propulsion" OR "thrust" OR "lift") AND "wing"
google_patent_queries.strategy: Very broad aircraft class with electric propulsion, vertical flight capability, and wing presence. Surveys entire electric VTOL landscape.
google_patent_queries.target: Electric-powered aircraft capable of vertical flight or hovering with wings, regardless of specific configuration or transition mechanism

google_patent_queries.search_string: (CPC=B64C OR CPC=B64D) AND ("payload" OR "cargo" OR "load") AND (("connector" OR "coupling" OR "interface" OR "hook") AND ("electric*" OR "power" OR "energy")) AND "flight"
google_patent_queries.strategy: Searches across aircraft and equipment subclasses for any aerial payload systems with electrical interfaces or power transfer capabilities.
google_patent_queries.target: Aircraft or aerial vehicle equipment with electrical payload interfaces, power transfer to cargo, or payload connectors with electrical connections

google_patent_queries.search_string: CPC=B64 AND ("convertible" OR "transform*" OR "reconfigur*" OR "morphing" OR "variable configuration") AND ("aircraft" OR "aerial vehicle" OR "UAV" OR "drone") AND ("flight mode" OR "orientation" OR "attitude")
google_patent_queries.strategy: Broadest search across all aircraft technologies for any convertible, reconfigurable, or morphing aircraft concepts with changing configurations or orientations.
google_patent_queries.target: Any aircraft or aerial vehicle with reconfigurable, transforming, or morphing capabilities for different flight modes, configurations, or operational states

analysis_metadata.technology_domain: VTOL Aircraft - Electric Propulsion - Convertible Flight
key_innovations: Foldable wings rotating about lengthwise (spanwise) axis
Paddle-based directional control with stanchion rotation
Boom-centric architecture with vertical/horizontal orientation capability
Integrated electrical payload power delivery system with dual-function airfoil rudder
primary_technical_advantages: Efficient cruise flight via horizontal flight mode
Compact storage via wing folding mechanism
Enhanced safety through shrouded rotor design
Multi-functional design elements (payload connector as rudder)
